data.title: WoF Retro Recap: May 7, 1993 — Friday Finals
data.meta_description: EPISODE #1920: SUPERSTARS OF SPORTS Phil Esposito: won $11K for American Foundation for Age Research Bill Walton: won $27,470 for Rex Foundation and Ex-NBA Players Association Dick Butkus: won $29,200 for Serra Retreat Center Round 1: CLUE Phil's first w/ two S's for $800, a $200 M, an N for the Free SPIN (like the…
data.meta_site_name: WHEEL of FORTUNE with Andy Nguyen
data.text:
EPISODE #1920: SUPERSTARS OF SPORTS

Phil Esposito: won $11K for American Foundation for Age Research

Bill Walton: won $27,470 for Rex Foundation and Ex-NBA Players Association

Dick Butkus: won $29,200 for Serra Retreat Center

Round 1: CLUE

Phil’s first w/ two S’s for $800, a $200 M, an N for the Free SPIN (like the previous night, he tried to pick it up before calling a letter), but then a baddie of Y. Second, Bill LaTed out (and he tried to ask Pat “Do I get another turn?” — no, you don’t). Third, Dick called up a $450 D, but then L for loss. On Phil’s second turn, he said a not-so-good consonant of G on $1K and used the FS. Next up were a $500 H, SIX T’s for another $1,200, three E’s, and a $200 F to clean out the consonants. After buying three O’s…

M O T T O

O F / T H E

_ N _ T E D

S T _ T E S

…he solved for $2,400, but did he know the MOTTO OF THE UNITED STATES for the $500 bonus? Not with a total blank. Bill, however, got the right one of “In God We Trust”.

DUDS: Y (Phil), L (Dick), G (Phil)

SOLE LaT: Bill

FEATURED PRIZE: Chevrolet Geo Metro convertible worth $10,954

Round 2: THE 60’s

(Oddly enough, $3,500 wasn’t used this round.)

Bill LaTed out from the get-go. Dick secondly uncovered two N’s for a grand, two S’s to double up, a $2,500 R, two A’s, a $600 T, three E’s, but then D for dud. Phil next picked a $400 B, but then repeated the D while on the car (and it appeared he dropped the “S-bomb” that got censored, and Dick was howling with laughter!). Bill got the car w/ the H…

_ _ E / N A _ A T H

_ _ N S / T H E

S _ _ E R / B _ _ _

…and he won it solving “JOE NAMATH WINS THE SUPER BOWL”.

SOLE DUD: Dick

SOLE LaT: Bill

SOLE DQ: Phil’s D repeat

Phil: $2,400/Bill: $11,454 cash & car/Dick: NOTHING

Round 3: SAME NAME

Dick instantly BANKRUPTed next to $1,500. Second for Phil were two S’s and N at $250 each, a $900 T, but then H for hush. Bill then said two L’s for $1,800, a single O, a $1,050 R trio, and an E buy, but time’s running out…

_ _ R _ L / _ N / &

_ L _ S T E R / O _

_ _ R _ S

…and the remaining consonant were worth $250 each.

Bill: three A’s

Dick: three P’s

A P R _ L / _ N / &

P L A S T E R / O _

P A R _ S

Dick just missed it after the buzzer w/ APRIL IN & PLASTER ON PARIS. Phil then said F…

A P R _ L / _ N / &

P L A S T E R / O F

P A R _ S

…and solved APRIL IN & PLASTER OF PARIS for $1,900.

SOLE DUD: H (Phil)

INSTA-BANKRUPT: Dick

SOLE DQ: Dick’s one-letter missolve

FINAL SCORES

Phil: $4,300 (left w/ $15,300)/Bill: $11,454 cash & car/Dick: SHUTOUT (left w/ $29,200)

GT: $15,754

NO BANKRUPT TRASH

Bonus Round

Bill picked the second E.

Category: PERSON

You might know her as the former “Material Girl” of the 80’s…

_ _ _ _ N N _

He’s looking good after calling MCDO…

M _ D O N N _

He IDed MADONNA and won the $25K for a final 2-day total of $63,924 for both his charities!
